segments.text: I love breathing fresh air in the suburb places , while sitting in the morning sunshine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can't agree more , honey . We need to get away from work from time to time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , just return to nature and feel the thrills of its beauty .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We are nor alone here . So many other families !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sure . The sunny days of spring are ideal for outdoor gatherings .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , let's go over there and put a blanket on the lawn .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK , you go back to our car and fetch the picnic stuff .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , so heavy ! What have you put in here ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Nothing special . Food , drinks , and Daniel's kangaroo toys .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Toys ? Why do we need toys for a picnic ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He said he would like to be our tour director and he lined up many things to do .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , then . May it really be a day of enjoyment . Other than that , we can also teach him something about science .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Science ? What are you talking about ? Forget about your science , OK ? It's a picnic !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I mean we can inspire him for a deeper understanding of the natural world .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I can't agree on that . Just cut it out . Give him a break and don't spoil the day .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , OK . you are always right .
segments.speaker: S2
